intro: Ochrothallus francii, commonly known as the French ochrothallus, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stem and compound leaves with a fern-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Ochrothallus francii is often found in open woodland and grassland habitats.
